result.execSummary:
The defendant Presly D. Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Bond on file applied. If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Attend and comply with Domestic Violence evaluation and follow through with an recommendations deemed appropriate with probation agent. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement, if not already on file. 

2 days jail credit, if revoked.

defendant.name: Bird, Presly D.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Blank DNA submission order

1:28 PM Defendant Presly D. Bird appeared by video.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Presly D. Bird. Victim appeared by audio. State in compliance with victim rights. Count 2 & 5 domestic abuse enhancer and repeater, Defendant enters a plea of No Contest. Count 3 as a repeater, Defendant enters a plea of No Contest. All other counts 1,4 & 6  and 22CM20 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes as well as 2/18/22 incident. Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense agrees to priors. He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his/her plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 2 & 5 Disorderly Conduct  contrary to 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a) Repeater, 939.62(1)(a) Domestic Abuse Incident, Count 3 - Criminal Damage to Property contrary to 943.01(1), 939.62(1)(a) - Repeater. Victim makes statement. Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 


Joint recommendation:  22CM11 Counts 2,3 & 5 - withhold sentence, 2 years probation, Costs, DNA, AODA and follow up. Domestic violence evaluation and recommended follow up. Risk and needs assessment deemed appropriate by agent. 2/18/22 incident charge, state is not issuing charges in that matter. 

Court adopts the joint recommendation: Sentence withheld, 2 years probation, Costs plus domestic abuse assessment, DNA, AODA and follow up. Domestic violence evaluation and recommended follow up. Risk and needs assessment deemed appropriate by agent. 2 days jail credit, if revoked.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement if not already on file.

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Bond covers 22CM11 and 22CM20
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: Victim 1

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Atty Sebion requesting to amend bond. Victim appears remotely. State responds, amend to no violent threatening or abusive conduct

9:00 AM Defendant Presly D. Bird appeared by video, Attorney Carly June Sebion for Presly D. Bird appeared by video, Attorney Marsolek  for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Waive reading of the complaint.  Defense stood mute/entered NGP.  NGP entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.  PTC set for 3/30  and STC set for 4/18 @ 3 PM.
